newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BLACKBURN CRASH OUT OF CUP TO STOCKPORT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BLACKBURN CRASH OUT OF CUP TO STOCKPORT.

text.p: Blackburn's miserable season continued on Tuesday when they were dumped out the English Football League Cup by second division Stockport.

Ray Harford's side lost 1-0 at home to a side 34 places below them in the league thanks to a first-half own goal from captain Tim Sherwood, who just 18 months ago lifted Blackburn's first English league trophy since 1914.

Tuesday's defeat compounds the Lancashire side's dismal start to the league season. After 10 matches they are the only club in the 92-team English league without a win, and sections of the home crowd chanted for Harford to quit at the final whistle.
Blackburn were not the only premier league side to struggle in the League Cup, the least prestigious of England's three soccer competitions.
Ruud Gullit's Chelsea relinquished a 1-0 lead to go down 2-1 at first division Bolton, while Wimbledon and Coventry could only manage draws against second division opponents.

High-flying Wimbledon, who have won their last seven league matches, were held 1-1 at home by Luton, and Ron Atkinson's Coventry, only one place above Blackburn in the premier league, drew 2-2 at tiny Gillingham.
Leicester were the only top-flight side to advance to the fourth round. They won 2-0 at York, conquerers of Everton in the previous round and Manchester United in last season's competiton.
There were no suprises in Scotland's only Cup tie.

Glasgow Rangers, humbled in the European Champions' League for a second successive season, continue to sweep all before them closer to home, routing Dunfermline 6-1 in a Scottish League Cup semifinal.
Danes Brian Laudrup and Erik Bo Andersen scored twice each for the Scottish champions and Derek McInnes and Jorg Albertz added one apiece.
Heart of Midlothian meet Dundee in the second semifinal on Wednesday.
